intro: Spergularia media, commonly known as sea sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial plant that typically thrives in coastal and saline environments. The plant has small, succulent leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it an important species in coastal ecosystems. Spergularia media is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines and salt marshes.
